FuncDef:
The qos link-adjustment shaping-mode command configures the mode of the last-mile QoS.
The undo qos link-adjustment shaping-mode command restores the default mode of the last-mile QoS.
By default, the last-mile QoS is of the frame mode.

ParaDef.Info:
Sets the mode of the last-mile QoS to frame.
-

Sets the mode of the last-mile QoS to cell.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The device can implement the link-level QoS on two types of links. It selects the mode of the link-level QoS according to the type of the links on the two ends of the DSLAM.If users are accessed through PPPoE, the mode of the link-level QoS should be configured to frame.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
If this command is configured in the AAA domain view, the command is effective with L2TP services only. If this command is configured in both the interface view and the AAA domain view, the command configured in the AAA domain view takes effect.
In scenarios where an LNS functions as the tunnel ingress, the LPUF-480 does not support last-mile QoS in cell mode.
